name: deimosrising
text: Ray. Smuckles. Is. A. Homeboy.

name: jake11
text: his moves are icky

name: behka
text: oh, philippe.  you have so much to give our country!

name: corbie
text:
I love this strip simply for Ray's noncommittal response.

"Okay"

name: centipede_damascus
text: Sadly, Philipe underestimates the amount of Americans who want to vote for someone who is five.

name: evolume
text: is THAT a statistic?

name: professoryes
text: It's not NOT a statistic.

name: tekende
text: But it SHOULD be.

name: tekende
text: Crap. I just now noticed your comment contains TWO "not"s. Therefore my response made NO SENSE.

name: deusoma
text:
Well, it didn't not not make no un-sense.

I think.

name: jaredwilde
text: A comment left by jaredwilde was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by trisha, RedMange, novacaine)

name: drycup
text: A comment left by drycup was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by MinorTough, rowboat, cailetshadow, DerSquirrel)

name: farqussus
text: OVERestimates.

name: madnes
text: Misunderestimates, even.

name: woodenteeth
text:
Miss Underestimates.

The most depressed in the Mr. Men series.

name: vulpes-aurum
text: Or possibly the most depressed in the Miss America pageant.

name: saucy_jack
text: If you're implying that lots of Americans would, I don't think Philippe is underestimating the amount. He's counting on it.

name: natashamarie
text: phillipe has wicked sack in this comic

name: the_voice
text: You better believe that he has wicked sack.

name: hikikomori
text: I can picture America as a whole responding to Phillipe's "Good morning. How are you." in an awesome way such as "It's going good thank you for asking we think it is great that you are five we support you"

name: deancain29
text: A comment left by deancain29 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by tekende, bixschmix, cailetshadow, gkiyo, Darthemed)

name: troy_convers
text: That shoulda been Bush's motto...

name: zem
text: ahahhaha holy shit this is some top-notch political humor

name: random_shorts
text: I can't tell if this statement is ironic.

name: steerpike66
text: This is as good a reason as any to vote for someone and better than most. Philippe is also a better public speaker than a certain Most Powerful Man in the World I Could Mention. Look at that podium work: raise fist, bring down, look right, look left. Good indignant eyebrows too.

name: cailetshadow
text: Don't forget that devilish Clinton-esque grin in his logo. That one's for all the ladies out there.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: thankfully though, no Clinton Thumb.

name: joeyramoney
text: phillipe always looks angry when he's campaigning.

name: tttt
text: ssslurrrppp

name: mr_lostman28
text: If you read what Philippe says in the voice of Mr. T it sounds really funny. He's also got this angry, embittered black man face on.

name: jerkface
text: he is five. one of the all time greatest lines. at least in the top, uh, five.

name: madnes
text: He is five. And so is this comic.

name: dovey
text: A comment left by dovey was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by joeyramoney, lateadopter, LocusCosecant)

name: clockworkorange
text: Phillipe's expression in the second-to-last panel is amazing. It is a perfect... logo!

name: professoryes
text: "How are you." With a period. Brass balls.

name: baryonyx
text: I would vote for him.

name: dasilodavi
text: I've said it a few times in various places, but I don't think that the gang's brand of encouragement is really what Philippe truly needs.

name: jawsh
text: philippe is five

name: charchar
text: I can just here a soft choruse in the background on the last panel, " Heeeee's FIVE ," I just can't convey it accurately. Damn internet.

name: cpnglxynchos
iseedeadpixels
text: I always thought ray was tokin' on a bong in the sixth panel. I'd check the book but it's at home.

name: iseedeadpixels
text: Seventh, FUCK!

name: fineoakstructure
text: You know, for a long time I always thought he was getting ready to light up a cigar (the round rip of the martini glass kind of looks like a cigar). Then I actually looked at the comic.

name: iseedeadpixels
text: I missed so much stuff like that on my first read through of the archives that I had to join assetbar and just look through it again. Also, I didn't know about the alt-text until about a quarter of the way through.

name: canusdivinus
text:
Oh Philippe, this country had already been run for four years by someone who was (essentially) five. The re-election was, in a way, a victory for Philippe.

Too bad they didn't share the same values.

name: kickstart
text: Philippe is the train they call the City of New Orleans.  (Honestly I cannot believe no one has mentioned this)

name: cracker
text: Thank you for watching UBC.

name: cracker
text:
Or UBS.

One of those.

name: fermatprime
text: The half-hour political infomercial here was prophetic on Onstad's part.

name: mercuri0us
text: How are you has no question mark.
